TopicTitle: Change action groups on a craft in space

Articles.Content:
So, I've restored a fine craft I had created and flown in 1.0.x, a true beast costing nearly a million, but worth every fund. I've upgraded it to newest parts and mods, removed parts that were dysfunctional in the original, then launched it - and after a good while, I discovered an action group for a very tedious and repetitive operation required is missing - somehow it didn't carry over from the old version and I failed to check that in VAB.

Can I somehow edit the action groups on a craft that's already in space? I don't think this monster can ever be landed (plus a lot of cost was in the boosters to bring it to the orbit, that won't be recovered) and it's really bothersome to perform about 20 clicks on parts every five minutes or so, to perform the action manually.

Do you have the original craft file? If so, you can try copying all entries in the

ACTIONS

{

}

section of each part you want to fix over to a copy of the new craft file.

 

DISCLAIMER: I do not know if any of the commands there have been changed.

Ah. That wouldn't work because the actions in the original aren't compatible, but you gave me an idea that should work. Load the craft into VAB, edit the action groups to be right, save it, then use the saved craft as a template for editing the savefile.

Cool. Tell us how it worked out. I'm sure more people would like to know.

Considering the craft with the launch stages was significantly different than the one in orbit (and docked to an asteroid), and this thing being huge, the file was practically enormous. Plus there were some other changes I wanted to introduce... so I just gave up, launched one with corrections introduced, carrying attachable parachutes (drones with parachutes and docking ports) and I landed the original. Not the most graceful of landings, lost half the gigantors, but otherwise, the whole endeavor costed me some 400,000 instead of a million.
Ok, that thing is.... sizeable. How did it survive the reentry? And how did it slow down in time? Drogue chutes en masse?

Powered descent. This thing is a high-thrust class E asteroid tug. With full tanks it can give the asteroid a good 200-500m/s of delta-V at 1-3m/s^2. Without an asteroid, it has over 4500m/s of delta-V (plus extra 500 in ore tanks), and when nearly empty its TWR is around clocking some 2.6, full still well above 1. 

Since it just finished hauling a class E into LKO, filling it up was not a problem. I didn't refill completely, just some 3500m/s. In orbit I braked to some 1200, then throttled down and never allowed the speed to climb above 1200, so nothing overheated. Then, at some 8km I slowed down to 200, and deployed the chutes. Still above 1km I slowed down to 100 or I'd lose the ISRUs... and then - on 24 parachutes and with nearly empty tanks I was still going some 16m/s... but one short burn just before touchdown killed that off too. All the damage was from it falling over, slowed down by the chutes but unable to prevent hitting the ground pretty hard - one ISRU broke off but I could recover it. Still, the gigantors and the radiator would be smashed under the weight of the hull alone - there was just no way to prevent it.
